Award.AwardTitle: MRI: Acquisition of a multifunctional magnetometer for advanced magnetic characterization and research training
Award.AbstractNarration:
DMR - 1337916
Lisfi

TECHNICAL SUMMARY:
This Major Research Instrumentation award supports Morgan State University with the acquisition of a multifunctional magnetometer for research and education. The instrument includes all the potential measurements typically offered by a vibrating sample magnetometer (VSM), a torque magnetometer (TMM), and a magnetoresistance setup (MRS). The multifunctional magnetometer will play a key role in investigating the magnetic properties of ferromagnetic functional materials such as highly magnetostrictive alloys, low-dimensional magnetic hetero-structures, magnetic shape memories, magneto-electrics, and organic exciton multiferroics. Researchers will be able to conduct a range of magnetic and transport measurement These measurements together with other techniques at the PIs institutions will be crucial in conducting cutting-edge research and advancing scientific knowledge in the field of magnetic materials. Knowledge acquired will contribute to engineering new advanced magnetics with superior performances over traditional materials, which will benefit the industrial sector.

NON-TECHNICAL SUMMARY:
This Major Research Instrumentation award will provide Morgan State University with funds for purchasing a multifunctional magnetometer for collaborative research and education. The instrument will be used to fulfill the needs of advanced magnetic characterization of various types of functional materials developed by the principal investigators (PIs) and their research partners at the University of Maryland, as well as to provide research training to students and faculty from their own institutions. This new instrument will facilitate the establishment of new research partnerships between the PIs and other scientists at other academic institutions and in industry. It will enhance the research infrastructure at Morgan State University (MSU), and will provide research opportunities to African-Americans, who are underrepresented in this field of science. The project will increase the competitiveness of the minority students in the area of magnetic materials at MSU. This will be done by providing a high quality of education and research training to the students involved in this program. This will have a significant impact on enhancing the opportunities for African-American graduates in the job market.

POR.DRECONTENT:
The acquisition of a multifunctional magnetometer by Morgan State University (MSU) under this MRI funding has considerably impacted research and education in this institution in many ways. (1) The acquired instrument has been serving research investigators from MSU and their research partners at other institutions by providing them advanced magnetic characterizations of various types of materials developed under their research projects. (2) This new equipment has been providing research training to undergraduate and graduate students including minorities students, who are underrepresented in the STEM disciplines. (3) This instrument has been playing a major role in accelerating research conducted by many faculty including the PIs, increasing their scientific productivity and their competitiveness by getting fast results, publishing more in high impact factor journals, and applying for more competitive grants. (4) The multifunctional magnetometer has been an engine for starting new research collaborations and consolidating the existing research partnership between Morgan and other institutions.

The acquired multifunctional magnetometer has been crucial for conducting cutting-edge research and advancing scientific knowledge in the field of magnetic materials. More specifically, the investigated materials include metallic alloys and ceramics in the bulk and thin film forms featuring large magnetostriction and low anisotropy for sensors and actuators applications as well as hard magnets for permanent magnets application. The broader impacts resulted from this MRI grant are listed below.

- The national and international dissemination of the results have contributed to the general intellectual discourse.

- The MRI fund has enhanced the research infrastructure of Morgan State University (MSU), which is an HBCU, and has provided research opportunities to minority students and faculty from this institution. This has enhanced the broadening participation in magnetic materials to African-Americans, who are underrepresented in this field of science.

- The MRI project has contributed to an increase of the competitiveness of minority students in the area of magnetic materials at MSU through high quality of education and research training. This has significantly enhanced the opportunities for African-American graduates in the job market.
